page.title: 07The village hall, Ousden
page.content: The village hall is where most activities take place. It is run by the village committee who organise various events there. Dances are also arranged although not as frequently now as they used to. The Womens' Institute meet there in the warmer months, but not in winter as the heating is inadequate. the Parish Council and the Community Council also hold their meetings in the hall which is also available for hire for such things as jumble sales, weddings and parties. Adjoining the hall is the playing field which is used for village events such as band concerts, car boot sales etc. The neighbouring village of Lidgate plays cricket there. The hall was originally a prisoner of war hut and was donated in 1920 by Mr Praed, who was then Lord of the Manor.Ousden day is held each year
